name: Coworking Space: Connecting the Dots (Yoyogi) in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Connecting the Dots (Yoyogi)
Connecting the Dots Yoyogi is the second location of Connecting The Dots. It is located in central Yoyogi, just a 10-minute walk from JR Shinjuku Station and 1-minute walk from Yoyogi Station

Located on the first and fourth floor, Connecting the Dots Yoyogi is intelligently designed and arranged to best suit your preferred work setting . The B1 floor has large conference room which can accomodate as many as 12 people. There are also a few private booths on this floor. The fourth floor has open coworking spaces with 2 meeting rooms which can host up to 6 people. There is also an event space, a meeting space.

Prices vary affordably from desks to booths, singles to groups. Registration fee is 540 YEN per group and individual. Prices are from 1350 a day for open seats and 2700 YEN for closed ones to 16200 YEN a month for open seats and just over 60000 for booths. Monthly members have the options of registering a legal business address with us at 5400 YEN per month, or registering your company at 10800 YEN per month.

What's better than that? You can use all meeting rooms for 30% OFF.

For a little extra you can use it 24 hours a day. See homepage for more details (in Japanese only). We have English-speaking staff!!
SHOW MORE

name: Coworking Space: Knowledge Society in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Knowledge Society
Knowledge Society is a large and spacious coworking space, virtual office, and rental office company which is located less than one minute walk from Kudanshita station in down town Tokyo. You may enquiry about their free weekly trial offer, and thereafter the monthly fee is 25.000. It also has 12 meeting rooms which can host between 2 and 63 people for all types of meetings and events. Drinks are free, and you can rent computers at the space as well. Opening hours are from 09:00 - 22:00.

name: Coworking Space: Studio 4 in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Studio 4
Studio 4 is a share office and a coworking space based in Shingawa with the closest station being Musashi-Koyama on the Tokyu Meguro Line.

The place is 62.7 m2, and standard prices are 30.000 per month, with access hours for the package being 09:00 -24:00. Amenities include internet, fax machine, lazier printer and an “event creation space". Please enquire for more details about our coworking facilities.

name: Coworking Space: TEISYOKU nishiazabu in Tokyo
description:
Overview of TEISYOKU nishiazabu
This shared office is located on the 7th floor of the noticeable building at the corner of Nishi-azabu crossroad.

We named the office “Teishoku,” which means set meal in Japanese, hoping there will be nice harmony among us. We set up events such as potluck party, or something that you can invite your friends too.

You can organize a meeting at the light lounge, and moreover, have a lunch party, set up an event, or get drink seeing the beautiful night view. Also, you can go and refresh yourself on the rooftop larger than 130 m2. In addition, we are planning to share not only the workplace but also part-time workers.
Join us!
SHOW MORE

name: Coworking Space: Co-Lab Sumida Kamezawa in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Co-Lab Sumida Kamezawa
Co-Lab Sumida-Kamezawa is a coworking space located about 9 minutes walk from the North exit of Kinshicho station. It is on the third floor of an office building and has both flexible coworking desks as well as dedicated desks. There are 20 coworking desks in total, 14 dedicated desks, 2 ateliers with 4 seats each, and a meeting room for 4 people. Prices for an open seat are from 12.500 while a dedicated desk will cost 29.000 to start. The atelier is rented out in its entirety for a little over 100.000 a month. Printer/scanner/copy machine is available. Please enquire if you have any questions about Co-Lab Sumida Kamezawa.

name: Coworking Space: Nagaya Aoyama in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Nagaya Aoyama
Nagaya Aoyama is a chain of coworking spaces with 4 spaces in Tokyo. The Nagaya Aoyama space is located near Omotesando station. It is a spacious and classy workspace. It has an open coworking space as well as private offices which can be rented. And as a bonus it has a terrance with a beautiful view over the city! The meeting room on premise can host 6-8 people, and of course there is a printer/photocopy machine and a scanner there. Price is 15.000 a month and the space is open 24/7.

name: Coworking Space: fabbit Kyobashi in Tokyo
description:
Overview of fabbit Kyobashi
Conveniently located by Tokyo Station, fabbit Kyobashi is a comfortable and inviting coworking space ideal for entrepreneurs, students, satellite work, and business trips. We offer one-day and monthly free seating and private office plans that include amenities such as free drinks and WiFi, rental meeting and event space, and extensive support services for startups.

name: Coworking Space: Space Bridd in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Space Bridd
Space Bridd is a funky, well designed coworking space in Kanda, the heart of Tokyo. It is located just two minutes walk from the A2 exit of Otemachi station, and 4 minutes from the west exit of Kanda station. There is space for 50 people. Using the printer is free of charge for the first 10 pages. A full time monthly membership is available for ¥10,000. Credit card is accepted.

name: Coworking Space: WeWork Hareza Ikebukuro in Tokyo
description:
Overview of WeWork Hareza Ikebukuro
Take your career to the next level in our shared office in modern Hareza Tower, located at the heart of Toshima City, surrounded by the entertainment and business of Nishiikebukuro. Five floors in this community-driven, 35-story building are dedicated to WeWork and feature vibrant lounges, collaborative conference rooms, and focus-fueling private offices so you can focus on creating your best work. From here, it’s only a five-minute walk to the metro and urban and regional trains at Ikebukuro Station—one of the busiest commuter hubs in the world. Before heading home, take advantage of the Japanese, French, and Western eateries in Nishiikebukuro, or attend one of the community events in the Hareza Ikebukuro complex. During lunch, browse the shops at Wacca with a coworker, or head to Naka-ikebukuro Park for a breath of fresh air. Professionals of every stripe are drawn to Ikebukuro for its lively energy and ever-growing business scene. If you’re ready to put your team at the center of the action, schedule a visit at 1 Chome 18-1 Higashi Ikebukuro today.
SHOW MORE

name: Coworking Space: SoftOffice Kinshicho in Tokyo
description:
Overview of SoftOffice Kinshicho
Softoffice is a chain of coworking spaces and offices with branches all over the Tokyo area. The Kinshicho office is located 7 minutes walk from Kinshicho station.

The premise occupies a single floor and Softoffice Kinshicho offers private booths only. Prices start at 35.000. An entry free of 15.000 plus one month deposit is charged, most contracts are long term. Amenities include a copy machine, a scanner, a photo copier, lazier printer, air conditioning, a meeting room, relaxing space, a refrigerator and a few other things. Open 24 hours.

name: Coworking Space: OSS Cafe in Tokyo
description:
Overview of OSS Cafe
OpenSource Cafe is a place frequented by people enthusiastic about open source. You are thus likely to find a lot of people into stuff like Linux and programming. Located about 7 minutes walk from the east exit of Shimo Kitazawa station OpenSource Cafe organizes meetups of mostly programmers and computer experts. Price is 1000 for one day and includes free drinks. Opening hours are 10-20 daily. Please enquire if you have any question about our space and community at OSS Cafe.

name: Coworking Space: SoftOffice Senju in Tokyo
description:
Overview of SoftOffice Senju
Softoffice is a chain of coworking spaces and offices with branches all over the Tokyo area. The Kita-Senju one is on four floors and has the air of a typical Japanese office space, which is not surprising as it used to be one. And as such, it offers mostly booths which cost from 30.000 and up. As Softoffice provides mostly long term rental contracts, you should check their site to see if anything is currently available.

Amenities include a copy machine, a scanner, a photo copier, free tea and air conditioning. An entry free of 15.000 plus one month deposit is charged. Open 24 hours.

name: Coworking Space: Academia Kichijoji Plus in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Academia Kichijoji Plus
Academia Kichijoji Plus is a learning center which also offers a small coworking space for women (only). Its located just a 7 minutes walk from the south exit of Kichijoji station. The price for a monthly membership is just 5000.. Amenities include wireless lan, a printer, scanner and a photocopy machine, and there is also a coffee machine at your disposal. Opening hours are 09:00 - 21:00. If you are looking for a female only place, this is a great option.

name: Coworking Space: Portal Point Aoyama in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Portal Point Aoyama
Portal Point Yurakucho is located in, Yurakucho, close to Omote Sando station. It is well decorated and clean with a modern finish. We have 3 floors of shared coworking space and is accessible 24 hours a day for members. Its lobby is modelled like the NY based Japanese newspaper NY Seikatsu. It includes an elegant work lounge, a meeting room, and office spaces as well as a 141 m2 of gallery space.

Flexible coworking space cost 30.000 a month, a private dedicated desk is 55.000 and private office for two is 95.000 per month. In addition there is a yearly fee of 15.000 - 45.000 depending on which package you select. A one year contract is required, there is no deposit, however a one month processing fee is charged.
SHOW MORE

name: Coworking Space: Soft Office Nakano in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Soft Office Nakano
Softoffice is a chain of coworking spaces and offices with branches all over the Tokyo area. The Nakano office is located about 15 minutes walk from Nakano station.

At a single floor, Softoffice Nakano offers private booths only. Prices start at 29.000. An entry free of 15.000 plus one month deposit is charged, most contracts are long term. Amenities include a copy machine, a scanner, a photo copier, lazier printer, air conditioning, a meeting room, relaxing space, a refrigerator and a few other things. Open 24 hours.

name: Coworking Space: Waku 2 in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Waku 2
Waku2 is located five minutes walk from Hachijoji station, to get there, you can take the JR Chuo line, or the Yokohama line. We offer a copy machine, free drinks corner, water cooler, coffee machine, a fridge, whiteboard, projectors and other coworking amenities to make your stay and work more productive and enjoyable.

Prices are 1000 for one day, 12.000 for a monthly membership (5 days a week) and 15.000 if you want to include weekends. Please enquiry with us if you have any further questions about our coworking space and amenities.

name: Coworking Space: SoftOffice Machida in Tokyo
description:
Overview of SoftOffice Machida
Softoffice is a chain of coworking spaces and offices with branches all over the Tokyo area. The Machida one is located within a walking distance from Machida Station, close to the Tenmangu Shrine and the city library. It has the air of a typical Japanese office space, which is not surprising as it used to be one. And as such, it offers private booths which cost from 57.000 and private seats which cost from 25.000. A few flexible coworkings desks are also available for 12.000 a month.

Amenities include a copy machine, a scanner, a photo copier, free tea and air conditioning.
An entry free of 15.000 plus one month deposit is charged.
SHOW MORE

name: Coworking Space: Co-Lab Futako Tamagawa in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Co-Lab Futako Tamagawa
Co-Lab are coworking spaces with offices all over Tokyo. The Futago Tamagawa branch is located just opposite to Futago Tamagawa station. Unlike most other Co-Labs the Futago Tamagawa co-lab
he is only on a single floor, however this single floor is ultilized to the fullest. On the north-east corner is a larger meeting room for 10 people, and in the south-east corner you have another meeting room of equal sizer. Between those meeting rooms are 5 private booths, and 7 flexible work desks. In the center of the room there are an several shared coworking desks, walled off by a circular wall. There is also a full kitchen, a tool lab, a library and an outdoor saloon all available to coworkers of Co-Lab Tamagawa.
SHOW MORE

name: Coworking Space: Style Minamiaoyama in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Style Minamiaoyama
Style Minami Aoyama is located in Minato ward (Minami Aoyama). Its closest station is Gaiemmae (about 3 minutes walk), and Omotesando (7 min walk). Located on a single floor, it has 35 seats, as well as a relaxing space and a terrace. Its and is decorated in the 60's style, so something unique for your productive creativity to be inspired by. A seminar room can also be used for 2100 an hour and is perfect for small business meetings. Prices are 400 an hour or 17.000 per month assuming a minimum contract of two months. Opening hours are 11:00 - 18:00.

name: Coworking Space: Gotanda Pao Coworking in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Gotanda Pao Coworking
Located only three minutes walk from Gotanda station, Pao is a trendy and clean looking coworking space. To get there, you take the east exit from Gotanda station and walk for 3 minutes to the KN building. Details can be found on the homepage (in Japanese only).

Pao often has scheduled events and fun stuff you might want to check out. If you want, you can even host your own. Price for full time membership is 15.000 a month, but you can get cheaper packages as well, like evenings only for 7000. Lockers and address registration, are available for a little extra fee.

name: Coworking Space: Kokemusazu in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Kokemusazu
Kokemuzasu a Koenji based coworking space located a short distance from Koenji station. It small cozy space is good for locals to build network and community. Opening hours are 10:00 - 20:00 Monday to Saturday, it its closed on Sundays. If you become a monthly member you can access the place 07:00 - 24:00 on Monday - Saturday, while it is still closed on Sundays.

name: Coworking Space: Connecting the Dots in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Connecting the Dots
Connecting the Dots is a coworking space based in Shibuya, just a short 4 minutes walk from the station.

Located on the 4th and 6th floor of the Kawahara building. The 4th floor has two conference rooms, a small one which can host upto 6 people, and a large one which can accomidate as many as 12 people. There are also a few private booths on this floor. The 6th floor has open coworking spaces.
There is also an event space, a meeting space and a cafe space which is also a bar for those who like to mix business with pleasure.

Prices vary affordably from desks to booths, singles to groups. Registration fee is 540 YEN per group and individual. Prices are from 1350 a day for open seats and 2700 YEN for closed ones to 16200 YEN a month for open seats and just over 60000 for booths. Monthly members have the options of registering a legal business address with us at 5400 YEN per month, or registering your company at 10800 YEN per month.

What's better than that? You can use all meeting rooms for 30% OFF.

For a little extra you can use it 24 hours a day. See homepage for more details (in Japanese only). We have English-speaking staff!!

name: Coworking Space: WeWork Kamiyacho Trust Tower in Tokyo
description:
Overview of WeWork Kamiyacho Trust Tower
Welcome to Minato-Ku, a bustling neighborhood of gleaming skyscrapers, buzzing nightlife, and memorable city sights. Spanning four floors in a 41-story skyscraper, our expertly designed workspace in Kamiyachō gives your team access to vibrant lounges for informal meetings, private offices for finalizing strategies, and conference rooms that increase collaboration. Commuting is seamless with direct access to Kamiyachō Station. After work, entertain clients with spectacular views of the city from Tokyo Tower, then savor the local fare at Tokyo Shiba Toufuya Ukai. If you’re ready to grow your company in this global hub of business and community, join WeWork at 4-1-1 Toranomon today.

name: Coworking Space: 8 Beat in Tokyo
description:
Overview of 8 Beat
8 Beat coworking space is located near Hachioji station. On the first floor, amenities include free LAN, and free drinks. Drop in price (2 hours usage) is 500 while a one day usage is 1000. Monthly membership are 9800, and for an additional 10.000 you can register your address there. And if you don't have a laptop, you can rent at the coworking space. Opening hours are 09:00 - 19:00.

name: Coworking Space: Vacancy Office in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Vacancy Office
Gotanda has its share of coworking spaces, and Vacancy office is one of the better known ones. Located one minute walk from the Tokyu Ikebukuro Line, and five minutes walk from the JR Gotanda station, Vacancy is open from 9:30 - 21:30 but 24 hours access is also possible for full time members. The spot can be used for two hours for 600 yen, a day for 1200. Projectors, screens and whiteboards can be used free of charge, there is even a parking space there if you decide to drive in Tokyo! Come join our regular hosted events and join our community. If you have any other questions about our coworking spaces and facilities please feel free to enquire.

name: Coworking Space: Wa Muse in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Wa Muse
Wa Muse is located a few minutes walk from Kichijoji station. It is a tasteful, relatively small coworking space, about 30 m2. It can accommodate up to 16 people. Opened in 2011, it has been popular amongst local and traveling professionals every since. The space offers a printer and a copy machine, as well as free coffee. Opening hours are 9:30 -17:30 on weekdays. An entry fee of 10.000 is charged. If you live or work near Kichijoji station, they are definitely worth checking out.

name: Coworking Space: Storage & Co-work in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Storage & Co-work
Looking for a coworking space in Japan?
Explore the next generation of coworking space in Tokyo with Storage&Co-work powered by Macromeister Japan Ltd.
At Storage&Co-work, located in one of the most prominent Tokyo neighbourhoods, a couple of minutes away from IIdabashi, Kagurazaka or Ichigaya station, we offer a flexible workspace to suit your own work style. Storage&Co-work is a place where diverse groups of freelancers, independent professionals, and remote workers work together in a shared, well-designed work environment around the corner from Kagurasaka (Tokyo’s Little Paris), a vibrant ex-pat area packed with restaurants, corporate offices and a sophisticated atmosphere.
Storage&Co-work offers a modern, friendly and international environment that can accelerate your growth straight away with the right resources, tools, and support. Storage&Co-work is a perfect workspace for fledgeling companies and business owners hoping to get off the ground and propel their business.
Our coworking space has a 24/7 member access and capacity of max 30 people with no monthly contract memberships fee. Storage&Co-work members enjoy plenty of additional benefits, such as the ability to register our address as your business address.
Access from the International Airport
• From Haneda Airport: 47 minutes
• From Narita Airport: 1hour and 10 minutes

• From Kagurazaka station:
o Toei Oedo Line Ushigome 5 minutes walk
o Tokyo Metro Tozai Line 11 minutes walk
• From Ichigaya Station:
o Yurakucho, JR Chuo Line 10 minutes walk

Check out Storage&Co-work, a coworking place where your new ideas and business can flourish.
_________________________________________________________
• No monthly fee, unlimited use for 0 yen per month
• WIFI Free of charge
_________________________________________________________
Storage &Co-work offers :
• High-speed WIFI
• Meeting room, café
• Printer
• Scanner
• Photocopier
• Computer (PC)
• Projector
• Microphone
• Air conditioning and heating

• Support in English
• Accepting PayPal as a payment method

Initial registration cost: 36,000 yen
Annual membership fee: 60,000 yen
Postal forwarding: +5,000 yen / month
Desk use: +20,000 yen / month
Locker usage: +5,000 yen / month
Furthermore, Storage&Co-work offers a variety of storage options available to match your business needs.
Prices for one-year rental vary depending on the size of the unit:
TA Type Size 950cmx950cm 9000 ¥ (+VAT)
TB Type: Size 950cmx1370cm 13000 ¥ (+VAT)
TC Type: Size 950cmx1790cm 15000 ¥ (+VAT)

name: Coworking Space: Co-ba Shibuya in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Co-ba Shibuya
Co-ba is one of Japan’s biggest coworking chains. This Shibuya branch, located smack bang in the centre of Shibuya, just minutes’ away from Shibuya train station, offering  lots of great food and shopping options.

This stylish coworking space is divided into three distinct area’s, each with their own unique colour theme and working environment. The brightly lit middle brown area contains a big shared coworking desk perfect for meeting other co-workers, as well as a library with many books to browse.

The white-themed area is equipped with a shared table and whiteboard, perfect for holding meetings or presentations with colleagues. At the far back of the office, is the darker black themed space. This area is best suited for coworkers who like quiet and want to focus on meeting an upcoming deadline.

Co-Ba also has over 9 different coworking spaces across Japan. Making it perfect for nomad’s and travelling professionals.

name: Coworking Space: Tachikawa Share Office TxT in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Tachikawa Share Office TxT
Tachikawa Share Office is a fancy, modern coworking space located near Tachikawaminami station, about 25 minutes west of Shinjuku by train. Our space has a variety of shared office space. You can choose between two types of private desks, the smaller on starting at 27.000 and the large ones which can actually accommodate multiple people starts at 43.000. There is also a meeting room available for private meeting and events. In total, there are 12 private offices and and we are open 24 hours a day 7 days of the week.

name: Coworking Space: WeWork Nippon Life Nihonbashi Building in Tokyo
description:
Overview of WeWork Nippon Life Nihonbashi Building
Situated just blocks from the transit hub at Tokyo Station, our Nihonbashi coworking space offers a wealth of conveniences for solo entrepreneurs and established companies alike. In this sleek, modern building rising above Tokyo’s Downtown Center, you’ll find art-filled lounges, collaborative conference rooms, and private offices ideal for teams of all sizes. Commuting is made simpler with the metro at Nihonbashi, Kayabacho, and Kyobashi Stations nearby. This location is also close to Fortune 500 companies, several banks, and only a five-minute walk from the Tokyo Stock Exchange, which keeps you in good company. After work, explore the many surrounding shops and restaurants, or treat new clients to an evening river cruise. Grow your business in the heart of Tokyo’s commercial scene, and join WeWork at 2 Chome-13-12 Nihonbashi today.

name: Coworking Space: Crosscoop in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Crosscoop
This centre is situated in famous the fashionable district of Aoyama, close to Harajuku and Omotesando. These offices are well-equipped with high-speed Internet access and furniture. Meeting room usage is free, and reception staff are always available on weekdays.

name: Coworking Space: WeWork Shibuya Scramble Square in Tokyo
description:
Overview of WeWork Shibuya Scramble Square
Steeped in creativity and innovation, WeWork’s coworking space at Shibuya Scramble Square is the ideal launchpad for your next venture. Situated in the heart of this modern complex, our multi-leveled workspace features light-filled lounges, collaborative conference rooms, and sleek private offices. Keep your commute simple with direct access to Shibuya Station; the JR, Metro, Tokyu, and several buses are also nearby. For a break between meetings, spend a quiet moment in our onsite meditation room, or enjoy the sunshine on our beautiful outdoor terrace. Known for world-class shopping, a thriving startup community, and one of Japan’s most vibrant music scenes, Shibuya is a lively locale to put down roots—and our Shibuya Scramble Square office space puts you right in the action. Schedule a visit to find out more.

name: Coworking Space: WeWork in Tokyo
description:
Overview of WeWork
A vibrant workspace comprising four-floors that provides flexible office solutions for teams of all sizes. This creative workspace features large co-working areas, private office space, and modern meeting rooms. Members have access to fantastic amenities ranging from office supplies to personalised support. Friendly reception staff are available to greet your guests. Living-room style break-out spaces are perfect for informal meetings or catch-ups with colleagues. Thirsty? Grab a drink from the communal kitchen area. Every detail has been considered so that you can focus on what matters: your business.

Under the gaze of Tokyo’s Imperial Palace, our coworking space in Chiyoda is a fitting foundation for your business. The entire 13-story building is dedicated to WeWork, affording you seamless access to light-filled lounges and collaborative workspaces. New startups are hard at work in our common areas and meeting rooms, while established companies run satellite operations in our sleek private offices. Commuting is a breeze with Kojimachi and Hanzomon Stations nearby. After work, explore the shops in the area or treat the team to a show at the National Theatre. The hustle of Tokyo is balanced by the tranquility of Hanzomon at our 2-3 Kojimachi office space.

description:
Overview of WeWork KABUTO ONE
A stone's throw from the city's stock exchange and close proximity to leaders in finance and technology, our vibrant Nihonbashi Kabutocho office space can help drive your business forward. Three floors in a 17-story tower are dedicated to WeWork and feature muraled lounges for greeting clients, modern conference room for team collaboration, private offices for heads-down productivity. Commuting is simple with the Kayabachō subway station connected to the building, and the regional trains at Tokyo station within walking distance. For a break between meetings, spend a moment meditating in our onsite wellness room, or walk across the historic Nihonbashi Bridge to the shops at Coredo Muromachi. Home to the headquarters of Japan's central bank, Chūō City is an innovative hub of commerce and culture. Join our Nihonbashi Kabutocho workspace at 7-chome Kabutocho to drive your career forward today.

description:
Overview of Venture Generation
Venture Generation is not just a coworking space, but also a “venture incubation center” to assist entrepreneurs launch their business. We offer internships, meaning you can work with prominent entrepreneurs as they grow their business in our space. We have all the amenities to help your business flurish and be more productive. This includes a copy machine/scanner/printer, a projector, a conference room, address registration, an IP phone, postal address registration, a snack bar, a 24/7 access and more. We are one of the more cosmopolitan working spaces you are likely to find in Japan with many people from Western and other Asian countries. If you want to work at an international place and have a chance to work with experienced entrepreneurs, you'll find a great community here. Please enquire if you have any questions about our facilities or services.

name: Coworking Space: WeWork Tokyo Port City Takeshiba in Tokyo
description:
Overview of WeWork Tokyo Port City Takeshiba
WeWork is a global network of workspaces where companies grow together. At this convenient address, discover floors of workspace and private offices. Our spaces are designed to promote productivity whether you’re a team of one or 100, and month-to-month flexibility means your space is just as agile as you are. Plus, one all-inclusive rate makes things easy. Any workspace can have a lounge, but ours are decorated with custom murals. Your old office might have had a coffee pot, but ours has a micro-roasted coffee bar and fresh fruit water. We’ve considered every detail so you can focus on your business. Beyond desks, staff, and amenities, find a community of forward-thinking companies and in-house events that connect you organically. More information on this location is coming soon, but we’re gladly accepting inquiries. Get in touch today to schedule a visit.

name: Coworking Space: Spaces - Tokyo, Roppongi in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Spaces - Tokyo, Roppongi
Stand out from the business crowd at Tokyo’s new Project R7 and discover an inspiring community of like-minded professionals. Every working space across the building’s nine floors has been designed with collaboration and creative freedom firmly front of mind. Whether you’re seeking shared offices or your own personal thinking space, you’ll enjoy 24-hour access to everything you need including an extensive number of well-equipped conference and meeting rooms with super-fast unlimited WiFi.


Located in the modern Minato ward, the area is home to a number of business heavyweights including Mitsubishi, Honda, Toshiba and Sony. Designed specifically for Project R7 has a choice of breakout areas including a roof terrace that overlooks the surrounding business district. With a host of transport connections nearby, including Roppongi Metro Station just three minutes away, you’ll be able to reach any number of leading cultural attractions in a flash.
Why choose Project R7.

✓Cutting-edge meeting rooms, conference facilities and virtual office capabilities.

Take inspiration from a spectacular new designer workspace.
Excellent bus and train links right on the doorstep.
Helpful staff and quality service within the heart of a vibrant business community."

Furthermore, Lockers can be rented for 2000 a month. An entrance fee of 3150 also applies.

name: Coworking Space: WeWork Link Square Shinjuku in Tokyo
description:
Overview of WeWork Link Square Shinjuku
Surrounded by the headquarters of commercial giants, WeWork’s office space in Shinjuku sets your team up for success. This prime location offers close proximity to Shinjuku Station and features art-filled lounges, collaborative conference rooms, and sleek private offices. Take advantage of our dedicated brainstorming room to kick-off big projects, then showcase your latest work in our events space. Between tranquil gardens at Shinjuku Gyoen and buzzing restaurants at Omoide Yokochō, inspiration comes easy at our Shinjuku workspace. Schedule a visit today.

description:
Overview of Crosscoop
This centre is an ideal location for businesses. Centrally located of Tokyo and close to major stations, this centre offers well-equipped offices with high-speed Internet access and furniture. Meeting room usage is free to tenants, and reception staff are always available on weekdays.

name: Coworking Space: Crosscoop in Tokyo
description:

name: Coworking Space: WeWork in Tokyo
description:
Overview of WeWork
Looking for a space central to Tokyo with all the flexibility you can imagine? This space has it. With a range of facilities, including unlimited coffee and fruit water on tap, plus a vibrant selection of custom-designed lounge areas, this centre is ideal if you're looking for somewhere to build your business empire - regardless of if you're a budding entrepreneur or you've been in the business a while. The on-site staff are available to cater to needs you didn't even know you had, from standard reception services (including telephone answering and mail handling) all the way to personalised administrative and tech support.

name: Coworking Space: KOKUA in Tokyo
description:
Overview of KOKUA
This centre offers a range of services, including virtual offices, secretarial services, shower rooms and high-speed Internet access.

name: Coworking Space: Compass Offices in Tokyo
description:
Overview of Compass Offices
This centre in Kamiyacho has been explicitly designed to provide a premium, professional location to meet businesses' modern-day demands. It offers solutions for one-person office to multiple-floor fit-outs, all on the same flexible and cost-effective terms. This centre affords 24 hours access and incorporates the newest workplace design and has the very latest and most advanced IT and telecoms infrastructure to give you the best possible support for your business. This centre includes well-furnished meeting rooms with video conferencing facilities. Speak with the experienced sales teams to help you choose which flexible configuration works best for your business.

name: Coworking Space: Regus - Sao Paulo, Paulista Center 3 - Augusta in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of Regus - Sao Paulo, Paulista Center 3 - Augusta
Our Paulista Center 3 is located at the 14th floor of Paulista Building, located at the heart of the most famous Avenue in Sao Paulo, on top of Shopping Centre 3 Mall. The building has Buildings A+ rating and access to the mall.


In the region, it is close to several service companies, education, government, banks and consulate, as well as renowned multinationals. It has the support of several hotel chains and all kinds of restaurants, theaters, museums and cultural attractions. The region also offers excellent transportation options with easy access to bus lines and subway stations. Centre includes:

name: Coworking Space: Regus - Sao Paulo, Chacara Santo Antonio, Alexandre Dumas in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of Regus - Sao Paulo, Chacara Santo Antonio, Alexandre Dumas
The Alexandre Dumas Center offers fifth-floor views from a striking tower block in a business district that's a magnet to national and multinational companies. Hosted by the 10-story, class-A Edificio Birmann 11 building - which boasts landscaped grounds, complete with palm trees - the center is located in the upscale Sao Paulo neighbourhood of Chacara Santo Antonio. As well as being an important financial services area that's home to many banks, companies from the commercial, technology and services sectors have also relocated here. The building has on-site amenities, but luxury restaurants and shops are nearby. Access to main roads and public transport is excellent and Congonhas Airport is 20 minutes away by car. Sao Paulo is the largest city in Brazil and is a business hub for the whole Latin America continent. Its diverse economy features a thriving services sector, and the city is also home to several important research and development operations.

description:
Overview of Regus - Sao Paulo, Paulista Casa das Rosas - Brigadeiro
The Sao Paulo Parque Cultural Paulista Center is on the fourth floor of a high-rise office block on Paulista Avenue, rumoured to be the most expensive stretch of real estate in Latin America. This eight-lane road is at the highest point of the city, and its skyline is distinctive because of the many radio and television station antennae. Paulista is a key financial district in a city that has the third largest stock exchange in the world, and a high proportion of millionaires among its population. Sao Paulo has over 1,500 bank branches as well as offices of many local and international banking and legal firms. The center has great public transport links, as many bus routes cross the 3km long Paulista Avenue, and there are metro stations close by. It takes just 10 minutes to get to the city's domestic airport.

name: Coworking Spaces in Sao Paulo
description:
About Sao Paulo
Much like the cupuaçu (cacao) fruit, this formidable megacity of 20 million has a tough outer layer that is unbreakable without the force of a hammer. A shambled infrastructure, constant traffic, air pollution, violent crime, and extreme poverty makes for understandable wariness about moving to São Paulo. But once chipped away, many come to love this multicultural hub of South America – grievances, contradictions, and all.

São Paulo is ideal for having the benefits of a metropolis at your fingertips while getting to take part in the relaxed yet vibrant Brazilian lifestyle. The sprawling concrete jungle has incredibe pockets of beauty, activity, and diversity, and though the disparity between classes is obvious, paulistanos are known for their optimism and passion for life, however it’s lived. Though it’s often bypassed on the tourist track for Rio de Janeiro, São Paulo has some of Brazil’s best world-class restaurants, cultural and entertainment attractions, and gratifying stumbled-upon finds.

For the digital nomad, it doesn’t hurt that São Paulo is the largest financial center in all of South America with the most powerful startup ecosystem. And with an emergent middle class, the market size continues to grow. Today the city hosts innumerable entrepreneurship and tech events and has the largest number of cafes and coworking spaces to hustle from in Brazil. Google even jumped into the mix and established one of its first six global campuses here in late 2015. With all the enthusiasm and opportunity surrounding the startup culture, this hub is as hot and addictive as doughy coxinhas fresh from the frying pan.

Much like Rio, the hoops of the rental process can be an incredible headache, amplified further by outrageous accommodation costs. A major reason for the high cost of living in São Paulo in particular is the lack of middle ground rental options. Expatriates tend to live in a limited number of expensive neighborhoods in the south and west zones of the city that have higher security and better infrastructure. Because of the hellish traffic, people choose to live close to their work, so properties near corporate hubs are significantly pricier. As a nomad, you’ll have more living flexibility, but all the other nomads do too, which can make for a widely dispersed entrepreneur community. Make sure you scope out your hub options before diving into this fascinating monster of a city

Find the best coworker community for you by clicking on our interactive map and exploring São Paulo's coworking spaces.

Overview of Regus - Sao Paulo, Regus E-Tower - Funchal
The Sao Paulo E-Tower Funchal Center is on the 35th floor of the 150m high E-Tower, one of the tallest structures in Sao Paulo, offering wonderful panoramic views of the city. It is located in the upper class neighbourhood of Vila Olimpia, a rapidly growing district that is home to the Brazilian headquarters of many multinationals, especially IT and internet service providers. The E-Tower building boasts 24-hour security, a fully equipped gym on the 19th floor, as well as two top quality restaurants and a helipad on the roof. At its base is the Daslu luxury department store, known for its designer brands. The building's postmodern design features a large entrance lobby with 10m high ceilings, and specially constructed pillars in the basement levels to provide the maximum number of secure parking spaces.

name: Coworking Space: WeWork Paulista 2537 in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of WeWork Paulista 2537
Located between Avenida Paulista and Consolacao, an area ripe for innovation across the finance, arts, and entertainment sectors, WeWork’s vibrant coworking space in Cerqueira César will keep you in close proximity to global leaders. Spanning 10 floors of a modern, 12-story building, this location features beautifully designed work spaces, world-class services, and special amenities like onsite showers and bike storage. When it’s time to unwind, swing by our dedicated game room or head downstairs for unbeatable access to retail shops, cafes, and restaurants. Commute in comfort with a direct in-building connection to the Trianon-Masp metro station, ample parking garages, and more than 10 bus lines in close proximity. Ready to elevate your workday? Book a tour today.
SHOW MORE

name: Coworking Space: WeWork Atílio Innocenti 165 in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of WeWork Atílio Innocenti 165
Our coworking space at Faria Lima sits on six floors of a brand new modern building in the Itaim Bibi neighborhood, known as the financial and high-level business center of São Paulo. Across Faria Lima Avenue, you can find major banks, law firms, startups, and established companies, like Google, Yahoo, Itaú BBA, JP Morgan and Credit Suisse. With names like that, it’s no wonder businesses from a variety of industries are laying down roots here. Just one block away from the hustle of the avenue, WeWork Faria Lima gives your team access to shops, restaurants, and popular “botecos.” For São Paulo coworking, WeWork Faria Lima can’t be beat.

name: Coworking Space: WeWork Nacoes Unidas 12901 in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of WeWork Nacoes Unidas 12901
WeWork is a global network of workspaces where companies grow together. At this convenient address, discover floors of coworking and private offices that cater to needs you didn’t even know you had. Our spaces are designed to promote productivity whether you’re a team of one or 100, and month-to-month flexibility means your space is just as agile as you are. Plus, one all-inclusive rate makes things easy. Any workspace can have a lounge, but ours are decorated with custom murals. Your old office might have had a coffee pot, but ours has a micro-roasted coffee bar and fresh fruit water. We’ve considered every detail so you can focus on your business. Beyond desks, staff, and amenities, find a community of forward-thinking companies and in-house events that connect you organically. More information on this location is coming soon, but we’re gladly accepting inquiries. Get in touch today to schedule a visit.

Selina is the fastest growing hospitality network in the world, travel, work and explore with us.

name: Coworking Space: WeWork Butanta 194 in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of WeWork Butanta 194
The most elegant coworking office spaces can be found in Pinheiros, a neighbourhood known for its cutting-edge art galleries, museums, and music venues. This Rua Butantã WeWork location houses 10 floors of workspaces, and is just around the corner from SESC Pinheiros, an iconic cultural center, and the El Dorado shopping mall. The modern hotels in the neighborhood also make it a convenient place to hold meetings with colleagues visiting from out of town, or as a midpoint for clients coming from either end of the city. Need an energy-boost during your day? Whether you like to pop out for an espresso at a cool café, or stay in to enjoy micro-roasted coffee in the office, we’ve got you covered. For office spaces that have it all and then some, look no further than WeWork.

name: Coworking Space: WeWork Jardim das Perdizes in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of WeWork Jardim das Perdizes
At the heart of São Paulo’s commercial sector, our coworking space in Jardim Das Perdizes provides a workday paradise for modern professionals. Three floors in this 17-story tower are dedicated to WeWork, featuring airy lounge areas, collaborative conference rooms, and sleek private offices. Commuting is a breeze with onsite parking and easy access to the 297A-10, 278, 231, and 399 busses. Plus, we’re pet-friendly. Surrounded by professionals in retail, public services, and commerce, it’s easy to make connections here—and our regular networking events help with the introduction. Ready to jumpstart your business in this vibrant city? Join WeWork’s coworking space in Jardim Das Perdizes today. \n

name: Coworking Space: Regus - Sao Paulo Faria Lima in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of Regus - Sao Paulo Faria Lima
The Sao Paulo Faria Lima Center is located on the fourth and fifth floors of the granite 16-story Antonio Alves Ferreira Guedes building, with its distinctive late Art Deco style. It was constructed in 1999 to meet the high technological and spatial requirements of one of the biggest original tenants, a global financial adviser, and has been voted the city's top triple-A rated building for its location, quality, user-friendly and energy efficient environment. The center has the protection of 24-hour security, fire safety systems and access control. The building also offers covered parking and a helipad. It is situated in a central business district in the prosperous Itaim Bibi area of the city. Leading multinational and Brazilian companies are based nearby, 63% of all international companies with businesses in Brazil have head offices in Sao Paulo. Nearby are professional amenities such as banks and print shops.

name: Coworking Space: WeWork JK Iguatemi in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of WeWork JK Iguatemi
In the heart of São Paulo, you’ll find an idyllic workspace in the upscale neighborhood of Vila Olímpia. WeWork Torre JK offers six floors of shared office space in a sleek tower above the JK Iguatemi shopping mall. Here, your business will be among a diverse group of companies in industries ranging from commerce and finance to arts and entertainment. Whether it’s after-work drinks at Villa Mix or client dinners at Ici Brasserie, this location gives you access to the neighborhood's premier dining and nightlife hot spots. You’ll also be near Parque do Povo, where you can recharge your creative energy with a walk in the park and a breath of fresh air. Getting to and from work is easy with close proximity to Marginal Pinheiros Highway and JK Avenue, not to mention onsite parking and bike storage. description:
Overview of Regus - Sao Paulo, Paulista Consolação – Ed. São Luiz
The Sao Paulo Paulista Haddock Lobo Center is on the ground floor of a 22-story office building on Paulista Avenue, an eight-lane thoroughfare running through the highest part of the city. The building has its own helipad, catering for the many private helicopter owners and helicopter taxi services in Sao Paolo. Other tenants in the block include diverse consultancies, telecoms, legal and finacial services and travel service providers, and the building offers on-site amenities such as a bank, cellular phone and stationery shops, coffee bar and secure parking. Paulista Avenue is one of Sao Paolo's central business districts, particularly attracting financial companies. Shops in this affluent area include leading fashion designers, jewellers and other brand names. Paulista Avenue offers excellent transport links. It is crossed by many bus routes and the centre is close to a metro underground railway station, providing easy access to both the domestic and international airports.

name: Coworking Space: Selina Madalena Sao Paulo in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of Selina Madalena Sao Paulo
Madalena is São Paulo’s bohemian, hippy neighborhood, where galleries, bars, and boutiques push the edge of what’s cool against the backdrop of graffiti lined streets. The vibe here is eclectic: you’ll find art students, trendsetters, and entrepreneurs discussing the next big thing over cocktails, while soccer games and live music play on in the background. Selina Vila Madalena captures the free spirit of this enchanting scene. Mix and mingle with like-minded entrepreneurs in our state-of-the-art coworking space. Stop by for a workshop, check in on our high-speed internet connection, or network with other digital nomads. We’re your one-stop shop for getting sh*t done.

name: Coworking Space: Spaces - Sao Paulo, Spaces Berrini in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of Spaces - Sao Paulo, Spaces Berrini
A glimmering addition to Berrini Avenue’s booming commercial area, this six-storey office space emits professional, contemporary elegance. The uniquely shaped steel façade, wide expanse of clear glass, and modern design features combine to create what’s sure to be a lasting first impression. Inside, you can take advantage of up to 95 light, airy, and fully equipped office spaces, complete with four conference rooms, break-out areas, and spacious meeting rooms – all available to use 24 hours a day. What’s more, the stunning terrace area is perfect for taking a break or lunching al fresco.


Getting to and from this business centre couldn’t be more convenient, with the Avenida Engenheiro Luís Carlos Berrini 828 bus station and Berrini train station both just a four-minute walk away. A 25-minute car journey will get you to Congonhas Airport. Bicycle storage is also available and, if you drive in, you can take advantage of underground parking as well as a valet service. This flexible workspace is situated next to an array of hotels, restaurants, museums and retail spaces, such as the D&D design mall. There’s even a small park to clear your mind in some green space.

name: Coworking Space: Pixels Coworking in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of Pixels Coworking
For us, coworking is not a workspace.
For us, coworking is a verb.
A daily practice.

We create our own model, which inspires us to build daily a space to develop our essence:
Community + innovation + music

# 1 Community
We are a group of people joining forces for the same goal, whether simple or complex.
We optimize resources, have different and complementary views and opinions, and count on each other in difficulties and times of celebration.
We bring the sense of collectivity inside and outside our space, we cultivate good relations in Moema and surroundings with focus on the sustainability of the region.

# 2 Innovation
Innovation for us is to get out of the automatic mode of life.
Stop, breathe and think about what we do and why we do it.
Bring different looks and construct new meanings because we understand that the world today is a complex system and we want to make it different from what has already been done.

Align our lifestyle with what we really need and want to build in the future.

# 3 Music
Everything we do involves music.
We use music as a medium and not as an end, we live and work with soundtrack, we gather for a good jam session or just with a setlist to liven up the crowd.
We leave the stage open for all those who want to experiment and give a straw of their musical gifts, here anyone has place to manifest their artistic side.

Located in Brazil’s biggest city Sao Paulo, home to more than 11 million people. Pixels coworking is situated in the southern district of Moema. Close to many local bus stop’s and a Bike Sampa bicycle station, where you can easily rent a bicycle and explore the city.

This cosy open plan coworking space features many shared work desks, high-speed Internet, free coffee and water. A meeting room that can be hired out by the hour perfect for hosting your next business meeting or workshop.

We have 24 private rooms, 2 meeting rooms, space for coworking and lots and lots of networking with a delicious coffee for you to enjoy every day.

We are certified COLATAM SAFE GUARD by BUREAU VERITAS, which guarantees that we follow all safety protocols and are a certified biosafety space.

We are 2 blocks from Fradique Coutinho Subway Station.

name: Coworking Space: Coworking Offices Vila Olímpia in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of Coworking Offices Vila Olímpia
Coworking Vila Olímpia with class: Coworking Offices
Take care of your professional priorities and let the entire bureaucracy to maintain an office at our expense. Rent your new office right here in the heart of Vila Olímpia, in the south of São Paulo city.



Corporate offices for your company in São Paulo – Brazil
Coworking Offices rents private rooms, workstations of all kinds, meeting rooms, an auditorium for events and virtual offices.

Private rooms for 4, 6 or 8 people are the ideal space for your business in São Paulo, the largest and economically important city in South America.

Immediate start.
Tax and business address.
Our partners can help your company to settle in Brazil – lawyers, accountants, etc.
Other facilities and convenience include:

– Large rows, natural lighting from floor to ceiling windows and ergonomic furniture, providing comfort and safety for our customers.
– Complete infrastructure. High speed internet, telephone, reception, 24 hour access. Meeting rooms equipped with smart LED TV, lounge with “espresso italiano” and auditorium at the roof top for corporate events.
The coworking is a tested and efficient model of sharing with others the working infraestructure environment, with the great benefit of reducing infrastructure costs.

The Vila Olímpia, in the south of São Paulo city, is a prime for neighborhood access, trade and diversified services, being the address chosen by thousands of companies.

Nothing more natural than a coworking placed in Vila Olímpia with personalized services and a complete and modern infrastructure. Thus was born the Coworking Offices, for those who believe in coworking model, but a high level of quality.

name: Coworking Space: Oficina Coworking in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of Oficina Coworking
Coworking Workshop is a democratic space that welcomes independent professionals to small and medium-sized companies, seeking a space in the most accessible region of São Paulo, with the comfort, tranquility and convenience that a corporate structure can offer, but without invading the privacy of our coworkers.

name: Coworking Space: Locus Santo Andre in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of Locus Santo Andre
Created in 2017 as an expansion step by the coworking conglomerate "Locus", Locus Santo Andre opened to meet the demands of customers seeking more options and privileged locations in Sao Paulo. Aiming to provide immediate solutions with low cost and risk to companies, professionals and entrepreneurs, Locus Santo Andre oozes the same sophistication and functionality as its sister properties dotted throughout Sao Paulo. Encouraging and supporting entrepreneurship as a way of life and a way to achieve personal and financial fulfillment, Locus know that it is hard to start out.

Locus Santo Andre has modern facilities and easy access to all regions of the Greater ABC. With the coworking structure, auditoriums, meeting rooms and full-time offices, the Locus Santo Andre offers a great option for the entrepreneurs of the region.

Here you will find coworking spaces where you can spread your wings, you will be able to create a virtual office, rent a private office and take advantage of the meeting rooms on offer. Having your office here will increase your professional image and business credibility. The space is relaxed and friendly with plenty of opportunities to showoff your networking skills on a daily basis. You will have everything you need to get your work done from speedy Internet to printing facilities for when you want to see words on paper. There is a telephone in each shared workstation and plenty of coffee to keep the brain waves happening. Check out their website for the coworking membership rates as they are affordable and flexible giving you the choice of joining for an hour, a day, a week, a month or even a year.

Fully furnished commercial offices have all the advantages of a physical office, without having to face the overhead expenses. Locus takes care of everything from reception services to cleaning, photo copying and stationery so that you can focus on your work or project. Comfy offices range in size and include administrative support such as reception and telephone service, cleaning, stationery, post office and printing facilities.

The creation of a virtual office will allow you to work from wherever you wish to and give you the services of a remote secretary with personalized and exclusive service, as well as a fiscal address to use. Coworking membership fees for a virtual office are varied and it would be wise to check out their website to find out which one suits you.

Fully equipped meeting rooms can be hired by the hour for business presentations, workshops or lectures and they are private with easy access.
SHOW MORE

description:

The Sao Paulo Square Vila Olimpia Center occupies the fourth floor of the 18-storey Continental Square office tower in the heart of Vila Olimpia. This is a prestigious and thriving area, home to the Brazilian offices of leading global businesses, particularly from the IT sector. The glass, aluminum and granite high-rise is part of a multi-use complex that includes a five-hotel and convention center, exclusive spa and gymnasium, restaurant and retail area. It is close to the Faria Lima central business district and prosperous Jardins neighborhood. The center is within walking distance of banks, the Vila Olimpia Mall and other facilities. This location is easy to reach from north and south and conveniently placed for main highways and public transport systems, including a train station a kilometer away. There is 24-hour access to the center, which is protected by CCTV and has its own secure parking on two basement levels.

description:
Overview of Regus - Sao Paulo, Alameda Santos - Paraiso - Brigadeiro
The center occupies six floors of the Victoria Plaza building located at Alameda Santos, 30 meters from the Paulista Avenue. The avenue is one of the most recognized in São Paulo. The center has a prominent position on a tree-lined street in the Paraiso business district, with neighbors that cover such diverse sectors as services, education, government, banks, consulates. All kinds of industries are represented in Sao Paulo as it is the financial hub of Brazil and therefore very popular with multinationals. It is also a major destination for exhibitions and trade shows in Latin America, served by many hotels chains and all types of restaurants, many theaters, museums and cultural attractions. The region offers excellent transport links. It is crossed by many bus routes and the centre is close to a three metro underground railway station, providing easy access to both the domestic and international airports and any other region in Sao Paulo.

name: Coworking Space: Locus Sao Caetano in Sao Paulo
description:
Overview of Locus Sao Caetano
Sitting next to Park Shopping São Caetano, Locus Sao Caetano coworking space was created in 2015 as another expansion step by the coworking conglomerate "Locus" who wish to meet the demands of customers seeking more options of privileged locations in Sao Paulo. Aiming to provide immediate solutions with low cost and risk to companies, professionals and entrepreneurs, Locus Sao Caetano oozes the same sophistication and functionality as its sister properties dotted throughout Sao Paulo. Encouraging and supporting entrepreneurship as a way of life and a way to achieve personal and financial fulfillment, Locus know that it is hard to start out.

Here you will find coworking spaces where you can spread your wings, you will be able to create a virtual office, rent a private office and take advantage of the meeting rooms on offer. Having your office here will increase your professional image and business credibility.

Coworking members will have a workstation in a relaxed space and the opportunity to meet people from the most diverse areas of business. You will easily be able to enhance and increase your networking on a daily basis. You will have everything you need to get your work done from speedy Internet to printing facilities for when you want to see words on paper. There is a telephone in each shared workstation and plenty of coffee to keep the brain waves happening. Check out their website for the membership fee plans, as they are affordable and flexible. Make sure you take advantage of their complimentary first day of coworking to see if it suits you.

Fully furnished commercial offices have all the advantages of a physical office, without having to face the overhead expenses. Locus takes care of everything from reception services to cleaning, photo copying and stationery, so that you can focus on your work or project. Comfy offices range in size and include administrative support such as reception and telephone service, cleaning, stationery, post office and printing facilities.

The creation of a virtual office will allow you to work from wherever you wish to and give you the services of a remote secretary with personalized and exclusive service as well as a fiscal address to use. Coworking membership fees for a virtual office are varied and it would be wise to check out their website to find out which one suits you.

Fully equipped meeting rooms can be hired by the hour for business presentations, workshops or lectures and they are private with easy access.
